sen.j: 大伴 旅人（おおとも の たびと、665年 - 天平3年（731年）7月25日 (旧暦)）は奈良時代初期の政治家、歌人。
sen.e: OTOMO no Tabito (665 - July 25, 731 (old lunar calendar)(September 4, 731)) was a politician and poet of the early Nara Period.
OTOMO no Tabito (665 - July 25, 731 (September 4, 731 in lunar calendar)) was a politician and poet of the early Nara Period.
OTOMO no Tabito (665 - September 4, 731) was a politician and poet of the early Nara period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: 父は大伴安麻呂、母は巨勢郎女。
sen.e: His father was OTOMO no Yasumaro and mother was KOSE no Iratsume.
His father was OTOMO no Yasumaro and his mother was KOSE no Iratsume.

sen.j: 息子に大伴家持がいる。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yakamochi was his son.
He had a son named OTOMO no Yakamochi.
He had a son named OTOMO no Yakamochi.

sen.j: 同じく有名な万葉歌人の大伴坂上郎女は異母妹。
sen.e: Another major poet of Manyoshu, OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume was his younger half-sister.
OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume, another major poet of the Manyoshu, was his younger half-sister.
OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume, another major poet of the Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), was his younger paternal half-sister.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 714年（和銅7年）、父の安麻呂が亡くなる。
sen.e: In 714, his father Yasumaro died.
In 714, his father Yasumaro passed away.
714: His father Yasumaro passed away.

sen.j: 718年（養老2年）に中納言に任じられる。
sen.e: In 718, he was appointed to Chunagon (middle counselor).
In 718, Tabito was appointed to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
718: Appointed to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 720年（養老4年）山背摂官となり、その後征隼人持節大将軍として隼人の反乱を鎮圧した。
sen.e: In 720, he was appointed to the inspector of Yamashiro and later suppressed an uprising of the Hayato people as Seihayato jisetsutaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the Hayato people").
In 720, he was appointed to Inspector of Yamashiro and later, as Seihayato jisetsutaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the Hayato people"), suppressed an uprising of the Hayato people
720: Appointed to Inspector of Yamashiro and later, as Seihayato jisetsutaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the Hayato people"), suppressed an uprising of the Hayato people.

sen.j: 神亀年間（724年－729年）には、大宰帥として九州の大宰府に赴任し、山上憶良とともに筑紫歌壇を形成した。
sen.e: Between 724 to 729, he served as Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazaifu offices) in Kyushu where he formed a poetry circle with YAMANOUE no Okura.
Between 724 to 729, he served as Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazaifu offices) in Kyushu where he formed a poetry circle with YAMANOUE no Okura.

Between 724 to 729, he served as Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazaifu offices) in Dazaifu, Kyushu where he formed Chikushi Kadan (a poetry circle in Chikushi Province [Tsukushi Province]) with YAMANOUE no Okura.

sen.j: 730年（天平2年）大納言に任じられ京に戻り、翌731年（天平3年）正二位に昇進するが、まもなく病を得て没した。
sen.e: In 730 he was appointed to a chief councilor of state and returned to Kyoto and promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in the following year, but he soon died of illness.
In 730, he was appointed to a chief councilor of state and returned to Kyoto and was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in the following year, but died of illness soon afterwards.
730: Appointed to Dainagon (a chief councilor of state) and returned to Kyoto and was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 731, the following year, but died of illness soon afterwards.

sen.j: 政治的には長屋王派と言われていた。
sen.e: As a politician, he was said to be in the Prince Nagaya's faction.
Politically, he was known to be in the Prince Nagaya's faction.
Politically, he was known to be in the Prince Nagaya's faction.

sen.j: 漢詩集『懐風藻』に漢詩が収められ、『万葉集』にも和歌78首選出されているが、和歌の多くは大宰帥以後のものである。
sen.e: His Chinese-style poems were included in a collection of Chinese verse "Kaifuso" (Fond Recollections of Poetry) and 78 waka (Japanese-style poems) were selected for "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka), many of these waka were made in the years after he became Dazai no sochi.

His Chinese-style poems were included in a collection of Chinese verse "Kaifuso" (Fond Recollections of Poetry) and 78 waka (Japanese-style poems) were selected for the "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka poems), most of which were written in the years after he became Dazai no sochi.

sen.j: 酒を讃むるの歌十三首（国歌大観番号0338-0350）を詠んでおり、酒をこよなく愛した人物として知られている。
sen.e: His set of thirteen tanka in praise of sake (kokka taikan (index to anthology of waka) No.0338-0350) indicates that he was a great lover of sake.
